author: news@mpnews.net (Staff)
title: Freshman football team escapes Washington
text:
Freshman football team escapes Washington Oct 22, 2015 
BY ANDY KRUTSINGER 
Mt. Pleasant News 
WASHINGTON â€” The Mt. Pleasant freshman football team pulled out a gritty win over Washington on Friday night. The Panthers and Demons fought back and forth all game, but in the end, it was Mt. Pleasant who walked away with a 17-14 road victory. 
Avante Henley had a big game for the Panthers, rushing for 76 yards on 10 attempts. He had the only touchdown of the first half, scoring on a two-yard run. David Blancas had a 26-yard field goal and two extra points. 
Zach Beason went 3-7 for 50 yards and a touchdown. The touchdown pass was a 35-yard strike to Chase Lamm, who had two catches for 43 total yards and one score. The defense was led by Beaston, James DeMeyer, Levi Puig, Tucker Johnson and Tate Shull. 
The Panthers moved to 6-2 with the win, and 4-1 against district opponents. They will travel to Ft. Madison this Friday to play the Bloodhounds, who are 5-2 and 4-1 in the district.
